enforce.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to make people obey a rule or law
enforce.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Parking restrictions will be strictly enforced.
Governments make laws and the police enforce them.
enforce.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to make something happen or force someone to do something
enforce.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: It is unlikely that a record company would enforce its views on an established artist.
enforce.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: He wants the police to enforce the law and arrest the men.
The president called for UN action to enforce the agreement.
The ban on commercial whaling can only be enforced with the international cooperation.
The EU has threatened to enforce sanctions by blockading the port.
You have to enforce classroom discipline or there is chaos.
The new parking restrictions will be strictly enforced.
Rules are only effective if they are properly enforced.
